org.gearvrf

Class GVRMain

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRMain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEventReceiver, IEvents, IScriptEvents, IScriptable

    public abstract class GVRMain
extends java.lang.Object
implements IScriptEvents, IScriptable, IEventReceiver
    Extend this class to create a GVRF application.

    All methods are called from the GL thread so it is safe to make GL calls either directly or indirectly (through GVRF methods). The GL thread runs at top priority: Android systems have many processes running at any time, and all default priority threads compete with each other.

      Whether the splash screen should be displayed, and for how long.

      • onEarlyInit

        public void onEarlyInit(GVRContext gvrContext)
        Called before onInit(GVRContext). This is used for initializing plug-ins and other early components.
        Specified by:
        onEarlyInit in interface IScriptEvents

      • onInit

        public void onInit(GVRContext gvrContext)
            throws java.lang.Throwable
        Called when the GL surface is created, when your app is loaded. This is where you should build your initial scene graph. Any expensive calls you make here are 'hidden' (in the sense that they won't cause the app to skip any frames) but they will still affect app startup time: use lazy-create patterns where you can, and/or use the asynchronous resource loading methods in GVRContext instead of the synchronous ones.
        Specified by:
        onInit in interface IScriptEvents
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - context to initialize.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - onInit() routines typically need to load various resources. Some of the Android resource-loading code throws exceptions (especially when you are loading files from the assets folder). If you don't catch these exceptions - and just let them propagate out of onInit() - GVRF will log the exception and shutdown your app.

        This is probably not the behavior you want if your resources may fail to load because of (say) network issues, but it is just fine for handling development-time issues like typing "mesh.obi" instead of "mesh.obj".

      • onAfterInit

        public void onAfterInit()
        Called after onInit() has finished. This is where you do some post-processing of the initial scene graph created in the method onInit(GVRContext), a listener added to GVREventReceiver or a GVRScriptFile attached to this GVRMain using GVRScriptManager.attachScriptFile(IScriptable, GVRScriptFile).
        Specified by:
        onAfterInit in interface IScriptEvents

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        target - object script is detached from.

      • onStep

        public void onStep()
        Called every frame. This is where you start animations, and where you add or change scene objects. Keep this method as short as possible, to avoid dropping any frames.

        This is the 3rd user-definable step in drawing a frame:

        • Process the GVRContext.runOnGlThread(Runnable) queue
        • Run all registered frame listeners
        • Call your onStep() handler.
        After these steps, GVRViewManager does stereo rendering and applies the lens distortion.
        Specified by:
        onStep in interface IScriptEvents

      • getSplashMode

        public GVRMain.SplashMode getSplashMode()
        Override this method to change the splash mode from the default automatic mode.
        Returns:
        One of the GVRMain.SplashMode enums.
        Since:
        1.6.4

      • getSplashDisplayTime

        public float getSplashDisplayTime()
        The minimum amount of time the splash screen will be visible, in seconds. Override this method to change the default. If the value returned by getSplashDisplayTime() is positive then the splash screen will stay up for getSplashDisplayTime() seconds in AUTOMATIC mode. In MANUAL mode, the splash screen will stay up for at least getSplashDisplayTime() seconds (if positive): closeSplashScreen() will not take effect until the splash screen times out, even if you call it long before that timeout.
        Returns:
        The minimum splash screen display time, in seconds. Any value less than 0 will result in the splash screen closing as soon as the framework is ready to render the main scene. The default value returned by this call is -1.

      • getSplashFadeTime

        public float getSplashFadeTime()
        Splash screen fade time, in seconds. Override this method to change the default.
        Returns:
        Splash screen fade-out animation duration

      • closeSplashScreen

        public final void closeSplashScreen()
        In manual mode, the splash screen will stay up until you call this method. Calling closeSplashScreen() before the display time has elapsed will set a flag, but the splash screen will stay up until the timeout; after the timeout, the splash screen will close as soon as you call closeSplashScreen().
        Since:
        1.6.4

      • getSplashTexture

        public GVRTexture getSplashTexture(GVRContext gvrContext)
        Override this method to supply a custom splash screen image.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The new GVRContext
        Returns:
        Texture to display
        Since:
        1.6.4

      • getSplashMesh

        public GVRMesh getSplashMesh(GVRContext gvrContext)
        Override this method to supply a custom splash screen mesh. The default is a 1x1 quad.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The new GVRContext
        Returns:
        Mesh to use with getSplashTexture(GVRContext) and getSplashShader(GVRContext).
        Since:
        1.6.4

      • getSplashShader

        public GVRShaderId getSplashShader(GVRContext gvrContext)
        Override this method to supply a custom splash screen shader. The default is the built-in unlit shader.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The new GVRContext
        Returns:
        Shader to use with getSplashTexture(GVRContext) and getSplashMesh(GVRContext).
        Since:
        1.6.4

      • onSplashScreenCreated

        public void onSplashScreenCreated(GVRSceneObject splashScreen)
        Override this method to change the default splash screen size or position. This method will be called before onInit() and before the normal render pipeline starts up. In particular, this means that any animations will not start until the first onStep() and normal rendering starts.
        Parameters:
        splashScreen - The splash object created from getSplashTexture(GVRContext), getSplashMesh(GVRContext), and getSplashShader(GVRContext).
        Since:
        1.6.4

      • getGVRContext

        public final GVRContext getGVRContext()
        Convenience method to get to the GVR context this instance is associated with
        Returns:
        the context if initialized and ready, null otherwise
